item.content:encoded:

item.title: Re: New wiki design
item.content:encoded: The new wiki design makes it look more professional but the colors are a little off-putting. Saw a recommendation for a lighter background; the color scheme could definitely stand a revamp for a bit more contrast.

item.title: Re: New wiki design
item.content:encoded:
While the new design is nice, no doubt, I'm so used to the old style that I'd prefer it over about any other skin. It's too bad there's no way to be able to switch between the two.

It's also gonna suck for all those IE6 users out there. While Opera is probably better than IE (I use FF3 myself; I hate IE), a lot of more casual players might be using a computer in which they can't download another browser, or feel awkward in getting a new one.

As for my feedback on this skin,
I also agree that I liked the old font size a little better. A little smaller, and you can fit more on a page.
I also think the background color, the grayish cyan, looks kind of weird with the white text boxes. Like Gogolu said, it could probably be a bit lighter.

Otherwise the new format looks good.

item.title: Re: New wiki design
item.content:encoded:
Notice

  • Curently the menu doesn't work for IE6. I strongly advise you to install Opera if you need a light weight browser.

Updates

  • Menus should work with IE6 too now.
  • Font size and colors set to the old values.
  • Background color set to transparent (like in the old theme).
  • Font default Verdana removed (only the Headings have it now). Tables look better with Arial.
